channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Government shutdown odds increase. And, Trump shifts stance on Russia-Ukraine war

item.title: Shooting at ICE detention facility in Dallas kills 1, injures 2 others
item.description: Authorities are investigating a shooting Wednesday at an immigration detention facility in Dallas. The Department of Homeland Security says there is a...

item.title: New York City may move its mayoral elections to even years. It'd be part of a trend
item.description: This fall, New York City voters will weigh in on a proposal that could move future city elections to even-numbered years. It's part of a growing trend...

item.title: Greetings from Guatemala, where one person's trash becomes another's colorful art
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Love pumpkin spice lattes? Learn some of its spicy history
item.description: For NPR's Word of the Week: Things are getting spicy. We explain how a word referring to cinnamon and pepper turned less literal by the 19th century.

item.title: Lead autism researcher weighs in on Trump administration Tylenol claims

item.title: Italy condemns 'drone attack' on Gaza aid flotilla and deploys frigate
item.description: Italy's defence minister directs a navy vessel to assist the flotilla's boats after what he says was a drone attack by unidentified perpetrators off C...

item.title: Typhoon Ragasa makes landfall in China after 17 killed in Taiwan
item.description: Ragasa is the world's strongest storm this year and has been roaring over the South China Sea for days.

item.title: Landmark deal paves way for cheaper HIV protection jab
item.description: The drug - a twice-yearly injection – reduces the current HIV treatment cost in developing countries.

item.title: 9/24: CBS Morning News
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel returns to air after suspension; CBS News speaks with leading researcher about White House autism claims.

item.title: Kimmel returns to late night with an emotional monologue but no apologies following suspension
Rosenberg: Russia brushes off Trump's claim of 'paper tiger' in aimless war
item.description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg says far from being riled by Trump's comments, Russia's response has so far been restrained.

item.title: The professor who beat fraud allegations to become Malawi's president…again
item.description: The president-elect of the southern African nation has a long and controversial political career.

item.title: Black church leaders reject Charlie Kirk martyrdom and point to his race rhetoric
